New Records: Aaron Boone achieved his 500th career win as New York Yankees' manager
New York Yankees swept the doubleheader at Fenway Park for the first time since 2006
Gleyber Torres contributed significantly with key hits and defensive plays
Carlos Rodon and Zach McAllister made notable performances
Boston Red Sox dropped to 73-72, affecting their playoff hopes
Key Match Events: New York Yankees swept the doubleheader
Gleyber Torres had a two-run single and a bases-loaded double play
Torres scored the go-ahead run on a bases-loaded grounder
Nick Ramirez secured his first major league save
Rafael Devers hit his 30th home run of the season
Pre-Game Insights: Aaron Boone's 500th win was a milestone achievement
New York Yankees were aiming to break a month-long streak of losing to Boston Red Sox
The doubleheader at Fenway Park had not happened since 2006
Weather and low attendance affected the game atmosphere
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone expressed pride in the team's performance
Boston Red Sox's playoff hopes were fading as they lost six of their last seven games
Manager Alex Cora emphasized the importance of continued effort for the Red Sox
Miscellaneous Highlights: The sweep was a significant achievement for the Yankees
Boston Red Sox struggled with runners in scoring position
New York Yankees' performance boosted their AL East standings
Key player movements and injuries were noted
